metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3184 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
mod_authz_svn in Apache Subversion 1.7.x before 1.7.21 and 1.8.x before 1.8.14, when using Apache httpd 2.4.x, does not properly restrict anonymous access, which allows remote anonymous users to read hidden files via the path name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only an issue with httpd 2.4. Needs to be built against httpd updated with CVE-2015-3185 fix, and needs to be forced as the security update didn't update the API version

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2').
